Class ec.ez.prim.ERun 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ez.prim.ERun
public class ERun
extends Object
implements Runnable
NOTE! All the methods of this class trust their callers to 1) only provide interned strings as verb, and 2) not modify an args array after passing it in. Btw, all source code literal strings are automatically intern()ed.

The static methods of the class are what E's "<-" turn into. An ERun instance is a Runnable that will run() a single delivery event.

ERun(Object, String, Object[], Resolver)
Reify a potential event

deliver(Object, String, Object[])

Do the described event now.
performOnly(Object, String, Object[])
Do the described event now.
run()
Do now the event that this ERun instance represents.

Do the described event now. Results are returned or thrown.

                            String verb,
                            Object args[],

Do the described event now. The result is reported to the resolver.

perform 
 public static void perform(Object rec,
                            Envelope e)
Do the described event now. The result is reported to the resolver within the envelope.

performOnly 
 public static void performOnly(Object rec,
                                String verb,
                                Object args[]) throws Exception, Ejection
Do the described event now. Results are ignored.

deliver 
 public static void deliver(Object rec,
                            String verb,
                            Object args[],
                            Resolver optResolver)
Ensure 'rec' will invoked in the way described, but queueing it onto the current run queue. These will be serviced in an order that preserves poEZ semantics.

'resolver' must be UNRESOLVED. When deliver() returns, 'resolver' will no longer be UNRESOLVED (i.e., deliver() forward()s 'resolver')

deliver 
 public static void deliver(Object rec,
                            Envelope e)
deliver 
 public static Promise deliver(Object rec,
                               String verb,
                               Object args[])
deliverOnly 
 public static void deliverOnly(Object rec,
                                String verb,
                                Object args[])
Ensure 'rec' will invoked in the way described, but queueing it onto the current run queue. These will be serviced in an order that preserves poEZ semantics. "Only" means we don't care about the result (including whether it succeeded), as is appropriate for event notifications.
